info.title: Lyft
info.description: Drive your app to success with Lyft's API

tags.name: Public
tags.description: Endpoints that do not require a user

tags.name: User
tags.description: Endpoints that require a user context

tags.name: Sandbox
tags.description: Endpoints that manipulate the Lyft sandbox

tags.name: Restricted
tags.description: Endpoints that require special permission from Lyft to use

get.description: Estimate the cost of taking a Lyft between two points.

200.description: An object with an array of cost estimates by ride type

400.description:
The 'error' field will be one of the following:
 * `bad_parameter`: A validation error occurred
 * `no_service_in_area`: start location is not within a Lyft service area
 * `ridetype_unavailable_in_region`: ridetype not supported at this start location

get.description: The drivers endpoint returns a list of nearby drivers' lat and lng at a given location.

200.description: An object with an array of available drivers sorted by eta for the given location

get.description: The ETA endpoint lets you know how quickly a Lyft driver can come get you

200.description: An object with an array of ETAs by ride type for the given location

400.description:
The 'error' field will be one of the following:
 * `bad_parameter`: A validation error occurred
 * `no_service_in_area`: location is not within a Lyft service area
 * `ridetype_unavailable_in_region`: ridetype not supported at this location

get.description: The v1 of this endpoint returns the user's ID, v2 will return more general info about the user. We require authentication for this endpoint, so we extract the user ID from the access token.

200.description: User ID was found and returned

get.description: Get a list of past & current rides for this passenger.

parameters.name: start_time
parameters.description: Restrict to rides starting after this point in time. The earliest supported date is 2015-01-01T00:00:00+00:00

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description: Restrict to rides starting before this point in time. The earliest supported date is 2015-01-01T00:00:00+00:00

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of rides to return. The default limit is 10 if not specified. The maximum allowed value is 50, an integer greater that 50 will return at most 50 results.

200.description: An object with an array of up to `limit` rides taken by the user between `start_time` and `end_time`.

post.description: Request a Lyft come pick you up at the given location.

201.description: An object with high level ride information. Use `GET /v1/rides/{id}` for more details.

400.description:
The 'error' field can be one of the following:
 * `bad_parameter`: A validation error occurred
 * `no_service_in_area`: origin is not within a Lyft service area
 * `ridetype_unavailable_in_region`: ridetype not supported at origin
 * `primetime_confirmation_required`: user must accept primetime. A primetime confirmation token and
details will be included in the response
 * `invalid_primetime_confirmation`: supplied token is invalid or expired
 * `destination_prohibited`: Lyft is not allowed to drop off at that destination (e.g. some airports).
 User-displayable details in the 'error_description' field
 * `client_error`: an uncategorized error. Details in the 'error_description' field

403.description:
User or client does not have permission to complete this request. Specific errors include:
 * `user_payment_required`: The user does not have a valid payment method on file.
 They must use the Lyft app to add or update one.
 * `account_disabled`: The user's account has been suspended, and they must contact Lyft support.
 * `user_in_driver_mode`: The user is logged in as a driver and can't request rides until they log out
 * `verified_phone_required`: The user has not provided or verified their phone number.
 They can add one in the Lyft app

409.description:
The 'error' field will be one of the following:
 * `no_drivers_available`: No drivers are available right now
 * `user_already_in_ride`: User cannot request a ride while in a ride

get.summary: Get the ride detail of a given ride ID
get.description: Get the status of a ride along with information about the driver, vehicle and price of a given ride ID

200.description: Detailed ride information including ride status, driver information, passenger information, vehicle information, location information and price

403.description: User or client does not have permission to complete this request

404.description: No ride found with provided ride ID

post.description: Cancel a ongoing ride which was requested earlier by providing the ride id.

400.description:
Cancellation token required
 * `cancel_confirmation_required`: a cancelation fee applies which the user must accept
 * `invalid_cancel_confirmation`: provided token was invalid or expired

403.description: User or client does not have permission to complete this request

404.description: No ride found with provided ride ID

put.summary: Update the destination of the ride
put.description: Add or update the ride's destination. Note that the ride must still be active (not droppedOff or canceled), and that destinations on Lyft Line rides can not be changed.

requestBody.description: The coordinates and optional address of the destination

200.description: Successfully updated the destination. Returns the new destination.

400.description:
The 'error' field will be one of the following:
 * `bad_parameter`: A validation error occurred
 * `invalid_destination`: Destination is generally invalid (eg. not in a Lyft service area)
 * `destination_prohibited`: Lyft drop-offs are not permitted at this location (eg. some airports).
 The 'error_description' field will contain an explaination suitable to display to the user.
 * `ride_is_lyft_line`: Cannot change the destination on Line rides
 * `ride_is_finished`: Ride has already been completed

403.description: User or client does not have permission to complete this request (`ride_does_not_belong_to_user`)

404.description: No ride found with provided ride ID

put.summary: Add the passenger's rating, feedback, and tip
put.description: Add the passenger's 1 to 5 star rating of the ride, optional written feedback, and optional tip amount in minor units and currency. The ride must already be dropped off, and ratings must be given within 24 hours of drop off. For purposes of display, 5 is considered the default rating. When this endpoint is successfully called, payment processing will begin.

400.description:
The 'error' field will be one of the following:
 * `bad_parameter`: A validation error occurred
 * `user_cannot_rate_this_ride`: Rides can only be rated once, within 24 hours of drop-off, and before
 the user starts another ride
 * `tip_too_large`: tip amount is too large for this ride
 * `tip_currency_not_accepted`: That tip currency is not accepted

409.description:
The 'error' field will be:
 * `ride_not_finished`: Ride is still in progress (not yet in the droppedOff status)

get.summary: Get the receipt of the rides.
get.description: Get the receipt information of a processed ride by providing the ride id. Receipts will only be available to view once the payment has been processed. In the case of canceled ride, cancellation penalty is included if applicable.

200.description: Detailed ride receipt information including cancel penalty if applicable.

403.description: User or client does not have permission to complete this request

404.description: No ride receipt found with provided ride ID

get.description: The ride types endpoint returns information about what kinds of Lyft rides you can request at a given location.

200.description: An object with an array of available Ride Types for the given location

put.description: Preset a Prime Time percentage in the region surrounding the specified location. This Prime Time percentage will be applied when requesting cost, or when requesting a ride in sandbox mode.

requestBody.description: Prime Time to be preset in the region surrounding the lat, lng

204.description: Successfully applied Prime Time in sandbox

put.description: Propagate a sandbox-ride through various ride status

requestBody.description: status to propagate the ride into

200.description: An object with the Ride ID and the new status

403.description: User or client does not have permission to complete this request

put.summary: Preset types of rides for sandbox
put.description: The sandbox-ridetypes endpoint allows you to preset the ridetypes in the region surrounding the specified latitude and longitude to allow testing different scenarios

requestBody.description: Ridetypes to be preset in the region surrounding the lat, lng

200.description: An object listing the ridetypes at a given location

put.summary: Driver availability for processing ride request
put.description: Set driver availability for the provided ride_type in the city/region surrounding the specified location

requestBody.description: Driver availability to be preset in the region surrounding the lat, lng

204.description: Successfully set driver availability in sandbox

404.description: ride_type provided in the path is not supported in the current area

error.description: A "slug" that serves as the error code (eg. "bad_parameter")

error_description.description: A user-friendly description of the error (appropriate to show to an end-user)

ApiError.description: Details about why a request failed, such as missing or invalid parameters

token.description: Token used to confirm the fee when cancelling a request

token_duration.description: How long, in seconds, before the token expires

cancel_confirmation_token.description: Token affirming the user accepts the cancellation fee. Required if a cancellation fee is in effect.

currency.description: The ISO 4217 currency code for the amount (e.g. USD)

cost_token.description: A token that confirms the user has accepted current Prime Time and/or fixed price charges. See 'Request a Lyft' for more details

currency.description: The ISO 4217 currency code for the amount (e.g. 'USD')

display_name.description: A human readable description of the ride type

estimated_cost_cents_max.description: Estimated upper bound for trip cost, in minor units (cents). Estimates are not guaranteed, and only provide a reasonable range based on current conditions.

estimated_cost_cents_min.description: Estimated lower bound for trip cost, in minor units (cents). Estimates are not guaranteed, and only provide a reasonable range based on current conditions.

estimated_duration_seconds.description: Estimated time to get from the start location to the end.

is_valid_estimate.description: The validity of the cost estimate returned

primetime_confirmation_token.description: This token is needed when requesting rides. (Deprecated)

primetime_percentage.description:
Current Prime Time Percentage. Prime Time adds a percentage to ride costs, prior to other applicable fees. When ride requests greatly outnumber available drivers, our system will automatically turn on Prime Time.
If Prime Time is inactive, the value returned will be '0%'.
Note: The returned estimate already has Prime Time factored in. The value is returned here for reference and to allow users to confirm/accept Prime Time prior to initiating a ride.

bearing.description: Bearing of the driver's car in degrees

phone_number.description: The driver's contact phone number. Must be E.164 formatted.

rating.description: The driver's rating based in 0-5 scale

ErrorDetail.description: An object with a single key-value pair, where the key is the name of the invalid parameter, and the value is a description of the error.

example.lat: (latitude) Missing required parameter in the query string

display_name.description: A human readable description of the ride type

eta_seconds.description: Estimated seconds for a driver to arrive

eta_seconds_max.description: Estimated upper bound of seconds for a driver to arrive

is_valid_estimate.description: The validity of the ETA estimate returned

lat.description: The latitude component of a location

lng.description: The longitude component of a location

type.description: The line item display name for a charge item

address.description: A human readable address at/near the given location

locations.description: the lastest recorded driver locations up to 5 sorted in chronological order.

drivers.description: list of nearby drivers group by ride type sorted by eta

ride_type.description: driver's ride type. if driver is eligable for several ride types, he will be duplicated.

time.description: Server time when the location object is created

base_charge.description: The base charge of the trip

cancel_penalty_amount.description: The charge amount if cancel penalty is involved

cost_minimum.description: The minimum charge for the trip

currency.description: The ISO 4217 currency code for the amount (e.g. USD)

first_name.description: The first name of this user

has_taken_a_ride.description: Indicates whether this user has taken at least one Lyft ride

id.description: The unique ID of this user

last_name.description: The last name of this user

Profile.description: Represents the general information about a user.

feedback.description: The passenger's written feedback about this ride

rating.description: The passenger's rating of this ride from 1 to 5

tip.description: Tip amount in minor units and tip currency

RatingRequest.description: Rating and optional feedback and tip

cost_token.description: A token that confirms the user has accepted current Prime Time and/or fixed price charges

destination.description: The *requested* location for passenger drop off

primetime_confirmation_token.description: A token that confirms the user has accepted current primetime charges (Deprecated)

Ride.description: Represents a requested, ongoing, or finished Lyft ride

beacon_color.description: Hex color code of the driver AMP device.

items.description: The array of actors who may cancel the ride at this point

canceled_by.description: The role of user who canceled the ride (if applicable)

cancellation_price.description: The cost of cancellation if there would be a penalty

destination.description: The *requested* location for passenger drop off

distance_miles.description: The distance, in miles, that this ride traveled. This field is only present after drop-off

dropoff.description: The *actual* location of passenger drop off

duration_seconds.description: Duration of the ride in seconds from pickup to drop-off. This field is only present after drop-off.

feedback.description: The written feedback the user left for this ride

generated_at.description: The request timestamp in date and time

location.description: The *current* location info of the ride

price.description: The total price for the current ride

pricing_details_url.description: The web view showing the pricing structure for the geographic area where the ride was taken

primetime_percentage.description: The Prime Time percentage applied to the base price

rating.description: The rating the user left for this ride, from 1 to 5

requested_at.description: The ride requested timestamp in date and time

ride_id.description: The unique ID of this ride

ride_profile.description: Indicates whether the ride was requested from the business profile or personal profile of the user.

route_url.description: The web view showing the passenger, driver, and route for this ride. This field will only be present for rides created through this API, or that have been shared through the "Share my Route" feature

eta_seconds.description: Estimated seconds for a driver to pickup or reach destination based on ride status

RideProfileEnum.description: The payment profile which the user has picked for the ride

charges.description: The break down of charge method

line_items.description: The break down of line items

price.description: The total price for the current ride

requested_at.description: The ride requested timestamp in date and time

ride_id.description: The unique ID of this ride

ride_profile.description: Indicates whether the ride was requested from the business profile or personal profile of the user.

RideReceipt.description: Receipt information of a processed ride.

destination.description: The *requested* location for passenger drop off

ride_id.description: The ID of the requested ride

cost_token.description: A token that confirms the user has accepted current Prime Time and/or fixed price charges

error.description: A "slug" that serves as the error code (eg. "bad_parameter")

error_description.description: A user-friendly description of the error (appropriate to show to an end-user)

error_uri.description: When a user must go through another flow before requesting a ride, this URI specifies which flow to use (e.g. an account challenge flow in a web view)

primetime_confirmation_token.description: A token that confirms the user has accepted current Prime Time charges (Deprecated)

primetime_multiplier.description: Current Prime Time multiplier (eg. if primetime_percentage is 100%, primetime_multiplier will be 2.0)

token_duration.description: Validity of the token in seconds

RideRequestError.description: Details about why a request failed, such as missing or invalid parameters

display_name.description: A human readable description of the ride type

image_url.description: The URL of an image representing this ride type

seats.description: The maximum number of seats available for rides requested with this ride type

RideTypeEnum.description: The ID of the ride type

RideTypeEnumWithOther.description: The ID of the ride type

driver_availability.description: The availability of driver in a region

lat.description: The latitude component of a location

lng.description: The longitude component of a location

lat.description: The latitude component of a location

lng.description: The longitude component of a location

primetime_percentage.description: The Prime Time to be applied as a string, e.g., '25%'

lat.description: The latitude component of a location

lng.description: The longitude component of a location

SandboxRideUpdate.description: Response when a sandbox ride is propagated through ride status

amount.description: A tip for the driver in cents. To be charged to the user's default charge account.

currency.description: The currency in which you want to tip. e.g. USD

OptionalEndTime.name: end_time
OptionalEndTime.description: Restrict to rides starting before this point in time. The earliest supported date is 2015-01-01T00:00:00+00:00

OptionalLimit.name: limit
OptionalLimit.description: The maximum number of rides to return. The default limit is 10 if not specified. The maximum allowed value is 50, an integer greater that 50 will return at most 50 results.

StartTime.name: start_time
StartTime.description: Restrict to rides starting after this point in time. The earliest supported date is 2015-01-01T00:00:00+00:00
